Subsystems v
Support v
Behaviours
Platform specific hit area
The hit area for the Switch is different depending on platform
standards. For example, iOS users expect the Switch hit area to
. i» . . be only on the Switch itself, whereas Android users are
tings ecings
accustomed to having a larger hit area including the Switch, the
newark network label and the distance between them. If the distance between the
wi » wi >» label and the Switch is too wide in a web platform, consider
having only the Switch as the active hit area. See hit area
ios Android & Web
Switches have instant effect
A Switch's value always represents the current state of a setting or feature. Changing
the Switch value directly alters the application as soon as the value changes.
Network Network
Wifi Wifi
L_________________________________________________________________________________ ____________J
(] A network setting Switch immediately puts the device into offline mode once 1] Switches do not require an additional confirmation action to become activated.
toggled.
Switch vs. Checkbox
Switches and Checkboxes are both binary toggles and often function the same way.
When choosing between the two, it's important to determine if your control is directly
modifying the application (use a Switch) versus collecting the user's selection as a piece
of data, which is either submitted or applied to the system at a later point (use a
Checkbox).
